<h1>‚òï JAVA INSTALLATION GUIDE</h1>

<p>A professional and styled guide to install Java and configure <code>JAVA_HOME</code> on Windows, macOS, and Linux systems.</p>

<style>
  pre {
    background: #1e1e1e;
    color: #d4d4d4;
    padding: 10px 14px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    overflow-x: auto;
    font-family: 'Fira Code', monospace;
  }
  code {
    background: #2a2a2a;
    color: #c586c0;
    padding: 2px 6px;
    border-radius: 4px;
  }
  .cmd { color: #569cd6; }
  .path { color: #4ec9b0; }
  .value { color: #dcdcaa; }
  .var { color: #9cdcfe; }
  .comment { color: #6a9955; }
</style>
<h2>W Windows</h2>
<hr/>
<br/>
<div align="center" width=50 height=50>
<img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="JVM">
</div><br/>
<br/>


<h3>üì• Step 1: Install Java</h3>
<p>Download the JDK from:</p>
<ul>
  <li><a href="https://www.oracle.com/in/java/technologies/downloads/" target="_blank">Oracle JDK :https://www.oracle.com/in/java/technologies/downloads/</a></li>
  <li><a href="https://jdk.java.net/" target="_blank">OpenJDK</a></li>
</ul>
<br/>
<p>Run the installer and follow the prompts. After installation, Java is typically located at:</p>
<pre><code class="path">C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-21</code></pre>
<br/>
<h3>üõ†Ô∏è Step 2: Set <code>JAVA_HOME</code></h3>
<br/>
<p>1. Open <strong>System Properties ‚Üí Advanced ‚Üí Environment Variables</strong>.</p>
<p>2. Under <strong>System Variables</strong>, click <strong>New</strong>:</p>
<div align="center" width=700 height=200>
<img src="IMAGES/JAVA_HOM.webp" class="execution" alt="JVM">
</div><br/>
<ul>
  <li><code class="var">Variable name:</code> <code class="value">JAVA_HOME</code></li>
  <br/>
  <li><code class="var">Variable value:</code> <code class="path">C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-21</code></li>
</ul>

<p><img src="https://media.geeksforgeeks.org/wp-content/uploads/20210405101631/Screenshot-2021-04-05-101533.png" alt="Add JAVA_HOME" width="600" /></p>

<p>3. Select <code>Path</code> variable ‚Üí <strong>Edit</strong> ‚Üí <strong>New</strong> ‚Üí Add:</p>
<br/>
<pre><code class="path">%JAVA_HOME%\bin</code></pre>

<p><img src="https://media.geeksforgeeks.org/wp-content/uploads/20210405101632/Screenshot-2021-04-05-101601.png" alt="Add to Path" width="600" /></p>

<h3>‚úÖ Step 3: Verify Installation</h3>
<br/>
<pre><code class="cmd">java -version
javac -version
echo %JAVA_HOME%</code></pre>
<p>Example output:</p>
<pre><code class="value">java version "21.0.2" 2025-03-01 LTS
javac 21.0.2
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-21</code></pre>
    
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<h2>üçé macOS</h2>
<hr />
<br/>
<div align="center" width=50 height=50>
  <img src="https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSbUYGb2TgS3NXO8yfYm_88y3WdoPmJlL_DtA&s" alt="JVM">
</div><br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<h3>üì• Step 1: Install Java</h3>
<br/>
<pre><code class="cmd">brew install openjdk@21</code></pre>
<br/>
<h3>üõ†Ô∏è Step 2: Set <code>JAVA_HOME</code></h3>
<br/>
<p>Add to <code>~/.zshrc</code> or <code>~/.bash_profile</code>:</p>
<pre><code class="cmd">export JAVA_HOME=$(/usr/libexec/java_home -v21)
export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH</code></pre>
<br/>
<h3>üìù Step 3: Open Configuration Files with vi</h3>
<br/>
<p>Use the `vi` editor to open your configuration files:</p>
<pre><code class="cmd">vi ~/.zshrc</code></pre>
<p>OR</p>
<pre><code class="cmd">vi ~/.bash_profile</code></pre>
<p>Once the file is open in the `vi` editor, press <code>i</code> to enter insert mode, then add the above configuration lines. Press <code>Esc</code> to exit insert mode, then type <code>:wq</code> to save and quit.</p>
<br/>
<h3>‚úÖ Step 4: Verify Installation</h3>
<br/>
<pre><code class="cmd">java -version
javac -version
echo $JAVA_HOME</code></pre>
<br/>
<pre><code class="value">java version "21.0.2" 2025-03-01 LTS
javac 21.0.2
/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk-21.jdk/Contents/Home</code></pre>
<br/>
<br/>

<h2>üêß LINUX (Ubuntu/Debian)</h2>
<hr />
<br/>
<div align="center" width=50 height=50>
  <img src="IMAGES/linux.png" alt="JVM">
</div><br/>
<br/>

<h3>üì• Step 1: Install Java</h3>
<br/>
<pre><code class="cmd">sudo apt update
sudo apt install openjdk-21-jdk</code></pre>
<br/>
<h3>üõ†Ô∏è Step 2: Set <code>JAVA_HOME</code></h3>
<br/>
<p>Add to <code>~/.bashrc</code> or <code>~/.zshrc</code>:</p>
<pre><code class="cmd">export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-21-openjdk-amd64
export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH</code></pre>
<br/>
<h3>üìù Step 3: Open Configuration Files with vi</h3>
<br/>
<p>Use the `vi` editor to open your configuration files:</p>
<pre><code class="cmd">vi ~/.bashrc</code></pre>
<p>OR</p>
<pre><code class="cmd">vi ~/.zshrc</code></pre>
<p>Once the file is open in `vi`, press <code>i</code> to enter insert mode, then add the above configuration lines. Press <code>Esc</code> to exit insert mode, then type <code>:wq</code> to save and quit.</p>
<br/>
<pre><code class="cmd">source ~/.bashrc</code></pre>
<br/>
<h3>‚úÖ Step 4: Verify Installation</h3>
<br/>
<pre><code class="cmd">java -version
javac -version
echo $JAVA_HOME</code></pre>
<br/>
<pre><code class="value">java version "21.0.2" 2025-03-01 LTS
javac 21.0.2
/usr/lib/jvm/java-21-openjdk-amd64</code></pre>

---

<p>‚úÖ Your system is now ready for Java development!</p>
